contextId.information: Most scholars believe Luke added this comment to describe the area through which Philip would travel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: This road is in a desert

contextId.information: This is background information about Sergius Paulus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This tells how many men were baptized. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: In all they were about twelve men

contextId.information: This word is used here to mark a break in the main storyline. Here Luke tells background information about Philip and his daughters. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
This is background information about the Sadducees and Pharisees. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: For the Sadducees ... but the Pharisees

contextId.information: This is background information about Publius' father that is important to understanding the story. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
contextId.quote: It happened that the father of Publius ... fever and dysentery
